column4: Hi, everyone. I have downloaded a *.chm file, and it seemed I cannot open it until I "unblock active content" by (if I use Windows Explorer) select Properties -> Unblock. How do I do that in Linux? I am using Ubuntu Gutsy and xchm. Thanks
have you tried the CHM reader?
thank you for your response. No, I've not tried it. I will install it soon.
check out the gnochm package, it's what I use
gnochm? okay
What kind of package should I install / configure?
'sudo apt-get install gnochm' should work fine
it will install "CHM Viewer" in the Applications - Accessories menu
okay, thank you. I've installed it. Trying...
I reopen the file, and it seemed that I only get strange characters like ËÉÿÅËÉÿÅËÉÿÅ... :(
strange.. it's a .CHM file?
similar with if I use xchm or another chm viewer..
hrm, where'd you get the CHM ?
yes, it came from http://www.supermemo.com/english/helpdown.htm
I'll try it out over here
Thank you. I've downloaded smhelp.chm, the latest one (2006)
it looks like they're using some IE hooks... I don't know if you'll be able to get it to work out-of-the-box in linux
is ther any other way to open it? If open it using Windows, could it opened in Linux after?
I doubt it... but you can get it to work in Wine, I'd bet
okay. I will try it. Thank you very much of your kind, nemilar :)
np.. hope it works for you
I've downloaded it, and it works! Thank you very much... :)
May be only md5sum problem..
